intro: Artanthe abutiloides, commonly known as the silky abutilon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to white. It thrives in warm climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal. Artanthe abutiloides prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
